longBusinessSummary: JDC Corporation engages in the construction business in Japan and rest of Asia. It operates through Civil Engineering Business, Construction Business, and Construction in Progress-related Business segments. The company is involved in the construction of dams, bridges, tunnels, roads, water supply and sewerage, landfills, stadiums, office buildings, apartments, and logistics facilities; and architectural design and business planning, building value regeneration, and food factory and seismic isolation engineering solutions. It also engages in the manufacture, sale, repair, and rental of construction and mining machinery; provision of coal ash mixed materials, refuse concrete, acetic acid absorbents, and adhesives; and operation of agricultural solar power plants and cemeteries. In addition, the company is involved in the development of electric power, transportation, ports and harbors, afforestation, flood control, irrigation, land reclamation, underground resources, and land; design, contractual, and management services related to civil engineering and building construction; provision of construction and stone materials, and chemical products; development, sale, rental, brokerage, management, and appraisal of real estate; investment, trading, brokerage, and management of investment equity; investment advisory; land and marine transportation and warehousing; quarrying; ownership, rental, and management of golf courses and ski resorts; travel agency; and environmental conservation activities, including soil and water remediation, as well as the collection, transport, processing, disposal, and recycling of municipal, industrial, and construction waste. Further, it engages in the provision of agricultural products and consulting services; generation and supply of electricity and heat; worker dispatching; and monetary loans, financial guarantees, factoring, and general leasing activities. JDC Corporation was incorporated in 1951 and is headquartered in Minato, Japan.
